page.title: 16FARMING IN NESTON:1
page.content: {Ashfield Hall Farm}is right on the edge of the built up area of Neston next to a modern electronics works. It has{180 acres}half of which are grass and the rest corn. The{corn} is used on the farm to feed the cattle. Only 10 tons are sold. The{grass}is used for grazing and for making silage and hay. The silage is made with straw on top. The{cattle}are fed the corn to fatten quickly, especially the male calves for beef. The cattle are sold for beef in Chester while the{cows' milk}is bottled on another farm in Newton, near West Kirby. Useful machines are the{balers}and {loaders.}Hired{combine harvesters}are used A{problem}facing the farm is that the owners,Cheshire County Council may develop the land for industry.
